title: MCP Index Server Complete Tool Inventory & Reference Guide
body:
# MCP Index Server Complete Tool Inventory & Reference Guide

## Overview
Comprehensive reference to all 37 tools available on the MCP Index Server, organized by functional category with usage patterns, stability indicators, and integration guidelines.

**Server Version**: 1.2.3  
**Registry Version**: 2025-08-27  
**Last Updated**: September 10, 2025  
**Tool Count**: 37 total tools (15 stable, 14 mutation, 23 read-only)

## Tool Categories & Inventory

### üîß Core System Tools (4 tools)
Foundational server operations and monitoring:

#### `health/check` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Server health status & version information
- **Type**: Read-only, non-mutation
- **Returns**: Status, timestamp, server version
- **Use Case**: Health monitoring, version verification
- **Schema**: `{"status": "ok", "timestamp": "ISO8601", "version": "semver"}`

#### `feature/status` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Active feature flags and internal counters
- **Type**: Read-only, non-mutation
- **Returns**: Feature flag states, operational counters
- **Use Case**: Feature availability checking, debug information

#### `metrics/snapshot` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Performance metrics for all handled methods
- **Type**: Read-only, non-mutation
- **Returns**: Method call counts, average/max duration, feature metrics
- **Use Case**: Performance monitoring, optimization analysis
- **Schema**: Methods array with `{"method", "count", "avgMs", "maxMs"}`

#### `meta/tools` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Enumerate all available tools with metadata
- **Type**: Read-only, non-mutation
- **Returns**: Complete tool registry with stability/mutation flags
- **Use Case**: Tool discovery, capability assessment, API documentation

### üìã Instruction Management Tools (13 tools)
Core instruction catalog operations:

#### `instructions/add` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Add single instruction with validation
- **Required**: `entry.id`, `entry.body`
- **Optional**: `overwrite`, `lax` mode
- **Returns**: Hash, creation/overwrite status
- **Use Case**: Adding new instructions with governance

#### `instructions/dispatch` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Unified dispatcher for catalog actions (list, get, search, export, etc.)
- **Required**: `action` parameter
- **Actions**: list, get, search, diff, export, query, categories, dir
- **Returns**: Action-specific results
- **Use Case**: Primary interface for catalog operations

#### `instructions/enrich` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Normalize placeholder governance fields to disk
- **Type**: Maintenance operation
- **Returns**: Rewritten count, updated/skipped arrays
- **Use Case**: Governance field normalization

#### `instructions/governanceHash` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Generate governance projection & deterministic hash
- **Type**: Read-only, integrity verification
- **Returns**: Count, governance hash, governance items
- **Use Case**: Governance state verification, drift detection

#### `instructions/governanceUpdate` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Update governance fields (owner, status, review dates)
- **Required**: `id`
- **Optional**: `owner`, `status`, `lastReviewedAt`, `nextReviewDue`, `bump`
- **Use Case**: Governance lifecycle management

#### `instructions/groom` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Catalog maintenance (normalize, repair, merge, cleanup)
- **Options**: `dryRun`, `removeDeprecated`, `mergeDuplicates`, `purgeLegacyScopes`
- **Returns**: Comprehensive maintenance report
- **Use Case**: Regular catalog hygiene, bulk operations

#### `instructions/health` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Compare live catalog to canonical snapshot for drift
- **Type**: Integrity checking
- **Returns**: Drift analysis (missing, changed, extra)
- **Use Case**: Catalog integrity monitoring

#### `instructions/import` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Bulk import instruction entries
- **Required**: `entries` array with complete instruction objects
- **Mode**: `skip` or `overwrite` for conflicts
- **Returns**: Import statistics, error details
- **Use Case**: Bulk catalog updates, migrations

#### `instructions/reload` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Force reload instruction catalog from disk
- **Type**: Cache invalidation
- **Returns**: Reload confirmation, hash, count
- **Use Case**: Development, manual cache refresh

#### `instructions/remove` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Delete instructions by ID array
- **Required**: `ids` array
- **Optional**: `missingOk` flag
- **Returns**: Removal statistics, error details
- **Use Case**: Instruction lifecycle management

#### `instructions/repair` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Fix out-of-sync sourceHash fields
- **Type**: Integrity repair
- **Returns**: Repair count, updated instruction IDs
- **Use Case**: Hash drift remediation

#### `instructions/search` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Text search across instruction titles & bodies
- **Required**: `q` query string
- **Type**: Read-only search
- **Use Case**: Content discovery, legacy search interface
- **Note**: Prefer `instructions/dispatch` with `action=search`

#### `instructions/inspect` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Debug catalog inspection
- **Type**: Development/debugging tool
- **Use Case**: Internal catalog state analysis

### üîç Data Integrity Tools (2 tools)
Catalog verification and quality gates:

#### `integrity/verify` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Verify instruction body hashes against stored sourceHash
- **Type**: Read-only integrity check
- **Returns**: Hash verification results, issue details
- **Use Case**: Catalog integrity validation, drift detection

#### `gates/evaluate` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Evaluate configured gating criteria over catalog
- **Type**: Read-only policy evaluation
- **Returns**: Gate results, compliance summary
- **Use Case**: Quality assurance, compliance checking

### üìä Usage Analytics Tools (3 tools)
Instruction usage tracking and analysis:

#### `usage/track` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Increment usage counters & timestamps for instruction ID
- **Required**: `id` parameter
- **Returns**: Usage count, timestamps
- **Use Case**: Usage analytics, popularity tracking

#### `usage/hotset` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Return most-used instruction entries
- **Optional**: `limit` (1-100, default varies)
- **Returns**: Hot set with usage counts, timestamps
- **Use Case**: Popular content identification

#### `usage/flush` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Flush usage snapshots to persistent storage
- **Type**: Persistence operation
- **Returns**: Flush confirmation
- **Use Case**: Usage data persistence, backup

### üí¨ Feedback Management Tools (6 tools)
User feedback collection and management:

#### `feedback/get` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Get specific feedback entry by ID with full details
- **Required**: `id` parameter
- **Returns**: Complete feedback entry
- **Use Case**: Feedback detail retrieval

#### `feedback/list` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: List feedback entries with comprehensive filtering
- **Filters**: `type`, `severity`, `status`, `since`, `tags`, `limit`, `offset`
- **Types**: issue, status, security, feature-request, bug-report, performance, usability, other
- **Severities**: low, medium, high, critical
- **Statuses**: new, acknowledged, in-progress, resolved, closed
- **Returns**: Filtered feedback list

#### `feedback/stats` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Feedback system statistics and metrics dashboard
- **Optional**: `since` parameter for time range
- **Returns**: Comprehensive feedback analytics
- **Use Case**: Feedback system monitoring, trend analysis

#### `feedback/health` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Health check for feedback system storage and configuration
- **Type**: System health verification
- **Returns**: Health status, configuration validation
- **Use Case**: Feedback system monitoring

#### `feedback/submit` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Submit new feedback entry
- **Required**: `type`, `severity`, `title`, `description`
- **Optional**: `context`, `metadata`, `tags`
- **Returns**: Submission confirmation, feedback ID
- **Use Case**: User feedback collection

#### `feedback/update` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable, Mutation
- **Purpose**: Update feedback entry status and metadata (admin)
- **Required**: `id`
- **Optional**: `status`, `metadata`
- **Returns**: Update confirmation
- **Use Case**: Feedback lifecycle management

### üõ† Diagnostic Tools (4 tools)
Performance testing and system diagnostics:

#### `diagnostics/block` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Intentionally CPU block event loop for N ms
- **Required**: `ms` (0-10000)
- **Type**: Stress testing
- **Use Case**: Event loop performance testing, CPU contention simulation
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Warning**: Can impact server performance

#### `diagnostics/memoryPressure` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Allocate & release memory to induce GC pressure
- **Optional**: `mb` (1-512)
- **Type**: Memory stress testing
- **Use Case**: Garbage collection behavior analysis
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Warning**: Can cause memory pressure

#### `diagnostics/microtaskFlood` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Flood microtask queue with Promise resolutions
- **Optional**: `count` (0-200000)
- **Type**: Event loop starvation testing
- **Use Case**: Microtask queue behavior analysis
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Warning**: Can cause event loop starvation

#### `diagnostics/handshake` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Basic connectivity and handshake testing
- **Type**: Connection verification
- **Use Case**: Basic connectivity validation

### üìù Quality Tools (1 tool)
Content quality and analysis:

#### `prompt/review` ‚úÖ Stable
- **Purpose**: Static analysis of prompts for issues & quality
- **Required**: `prompt` text
- **Returns**: Issues array, summary analysis, length metrics
- **Use Case**: Prompt quality assurance, content validation

### üóÇ Testing Tools (1 tool)
Basic testing functionality:

#### `test/primitive` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Basic testing functionality
- **Type**: Development/testing tool
- **Use Case**: Server testing, development validation

### üîó Integration Tools (2 tools)
Catalog integrity and metadata:

#### `integrity/manifest` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Generate catalog manifest for integrity checking
- **Type**: Integrity metadata
- **Use Case**: Catalog state documentation

#### `instructions/debugCatalog` ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable
- **Purpose**: Debug catalog internal state
- **Type**: Development/debugging
- **Use Case**: Internal state inspection

## Tool Stability Classifications

### ‚úÖ Stable Tools (15 tools)
Production-ready APIs with backward compatibility:
- `health/check`, `metrics/snapshot`, `meta/tools`
- `instructions/dispatch`, `instructions/governanceHash`, `instructions/search`
- `integrity/verify`, `gates/evaluate`
- `usage/track`, `usage/hotset`
- `feedback/get`, `feedback/list`, `feedback/stats`, `feedback/health`
- `prompt/review`

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable Tools (22 tools)
Development/beta APIs subject to change:
- All diagnostic tools
- Most mutation operations
- Advanced catalog management
- System maintenance functions

## Mutation vs Read-Only Tools

### üîÑ Mutation Tools (14 tools)
Tools that modify server state:
- `instructions/add`, `instructions/enrich`, `instructions/governanceUpdate`
- `instructions/groom`, `instructions/import`, `instructions/reload`
- `instructions/remove`, `instructions/repair`
- `usage/flush`
- `feedback/submit`, `feedback/update`
- All diagnostic tools (temporary state changes)

### üìñ Read-Only Tools (23 tools)
Query and analysis tools:
- All core system tools
- Most instruction catalog queries
- Integrity verification tools
- Analytics and reporting tools
- Quality analysis tools

## Usage Patterns & Best Practices

### Development Workflow
1. **Discovery**: Use `meta/tools` for capability assessment
2. **Health Check**: Regular `health/check` monitoring
3. **Catalog Operations**: Primary interface via `instructions/dispatch`
4. **Quality Assurance**: `integrity/verify` and `gates/evaluate`
5. **Analytics**: `usage/hotset` and `feedback/stats` for insights

### Production Operations
1. **Monitoring**: `health/check`, `metrics/snapshot`
2. **Maintenance**: `instructions/groom` with `dryRun` first
3. **Integrity**: Regular `integrity/verify` checks
4. **Analytics**: `usage/hotset` for content optimization

### Safety Guidelines
1. **Avoid diagnostic tools in production** (performance impact)
2. **Use `dryRun` mode** for destructive operations
3. **Verify before mutation** with read-only tools first
4. **Monitor metrics** after bulk operations

## Integration Examples

### PowerShell Integration
```powershell
# Health check
$health = Invoke-MCPTool -Server "mcp-index-server" -Tool "health/check"

# Get tool inventory
$tools = Invoke-MCPTool -Server "mcp-index-server" -Tool "meta/tools"

# Search instructions
$results = Invoke-MCPTool -Server "mcp-index-server" -Tool "instructions/dispatch" -Params @{action="search"; q="PowerShell"}

# Get popular instructions
$hotset = Invoke-MCPTool -Server "mcp-index-server" -Tool "usage/hotset" -Params @{limit=10}
```

### VS Code MCP Integration
```jsonc
// User toolset for instruction management
{
  "instructionManagement": {
    "tools": ["instructions-dispatch", "instructions-search", "usage-hotset", "integrity-verify"],
    "description": "Core instruction catalog operations",
    "icon": "library"
  }
}
```

## Performance Characteristics

### High-Performance Tools
- `health/check` - Minimal overhead
- `meta/tools` - Cached metadata
- `instructions/search` - Optimized text search

### Resource-Intensive Tools
- `instructions/groom` - Bulk operations
- `integrity/verify` - Hash computation
- `diagnostics/*` - Intentional resource usage

### Caching Behavior
- Tool metadata cached until server restart
- Instruction catalog cached with invalidation
- Usage analytics buffered before persistence

## Error Handling Patterns

### Common Error Responses
- `{"error": "message"}` - Standard error format
- `{"notFound": true}` - Resource not found
- `{"featureDisabled": true}` - Feature unavailable

### Validation Failures
- Schema validation errors with detailed messages
- ID conflicts with existing instructions
- Governance policy violations

## Security Considerations

### Access Control
- All tools require MCP authentication
- Mutation tools may require elevated privileges
- Diagnostic tools should be restricted in production

### Data Protection
- Feedback system handles sensitive information
- Instruction content may contain proprietary information
- Usage analytics respect privacy boundaries

## Maintenance & Updates

### Regular Maintenance
- Weekly `integrity/verify` checks
- Monthly `instructions/groom` operations
- Quarterly `feedback/stats` reviews

### Version Management
- Server version tracked in `health/check`
- Tool registry versioned independently
- Breaking changes flagged in stability classification

### Monitoring Recommendations
- `metrics/snapshot` for performance trends
- `feedback/stats` for user satisfaction
- `usage/hotset` for content optimization

## Conclusion

The MCP Index Server provides a comprehensive toolkit for instruction catalog management, quality assurance, and system operations. With 37 specialized tools across 8 functional categories, it supports the complete lifecycle of instruction management from creation to analytics.

**Key Strengths:**
- Comprehensive instruction lifecycle management
- Built-in integrity and quality assurance
- Rich analytics and feedback capabilities
- Robust diagnostic and maintenance tools
- Clear stability and mutation classifications

**Best Practices:**
- Use stable APIs for production workflows
- Leverage `instructions/dispatch` as primary interface
- Regular integrity checking and maintenance
- Monitor performance through metrics tools
- Collect and analyze user feedback for continuous improvement

This tool inventory serves as the definitive reference for MCP Index Server capabilities, enabling effective integration and optimal usage patterns.
